top: Hundreds of millions in China have hustled to enjoy their first major national holiday since the country claimed to have contained its COVID-19 outbreak.
Authorities estimated that around 550 million people will make trips within the country during the Golden Week this year, an eight-day holiday celebrating China's National Day

This year, travel restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic mean that some 600 million tourists - about 40% of the population - will travel within China during the holiday that began Thursday, according to Ctrip, China's largest online travel agency.
